sentence.Network_en: Cope: a long ecclesiastical vestment worn over an alb or surplice.
sentence.Network_cn: 长袍: 一种传教士所穿的长袍,穿在白长袍或白法衣外面.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French sourpelis, from medieval Latin superpellicium, from super- 'above' + pellicia 'fur garment'

entry.tran: (教士和唱诗班成员穿的)白色罩衣
entry.def: A surplice is a loose white knee-length garment which is worn over a longer garment by priests and members of the choir in some churches.

example.ex: ...the priest and choir in their lace surplices.
example.tran: 穿着蕾丝白色罩袍的教士和唱诗班

means.word_mean: 1. a loose-fitting white ecclesiastical vestment with wide sleeves
